item.title: starlight
item.description: name: inverse layout: true class: center, middle, inverse --- # starlight .footnote[Go directly to [project site](https://github.com/gnab/remark)] --- layout: false # Research question ## When an alter is elevated in status, what does ego do? -- ### The question is typically star-centric -- ### Much is said about what happens to high-status actors after ascension - Performance suffers (Bothner, Kim, and Smith 2012) - Personal crises: ‘Oscar Curse’ (Jensen and Kim 2015) --- .

item.title: Status Spillovers

Course Introduction document.write('') # Innovation and Entrepreneurship ### MBA 670 Marriott School of Business Brian P. Reschke Fall 2017 --- -- *** ## Course Introduction *** speaker notes FTW! could this be any simpler? ## Learning Outcomes 1. Generate creative new ideas 1. Understand customers and competitive contexts 1. Formulate and prioritize hypotheses 1. Design and create elegant solutions 1. Validate entrepreneurial opportunities *** ## Individual Assignments *** *** ## Idea Log *** “If you want to have good ideas you must have many ideas.

Course Introduction document.write('') # Entrepreneurial Innovation ### BusM 470 Marriott School of Business Brian P. Reschke Fall 2017 --- -- *** ## Course Introduction *** speaker notes FTW! could this be any simpler? ## Learning Outcomes 1. Generate creative new ideas 1. Understand customers and competitive contexts 1. Formulate and prioritize hypotheses 1. Design and create elegant solutions 1. Validate entrepreneurial opportunities *** ## Individual Assignments *** *** ## Idea Log *** “If you want to have good ideas you must have many ideas.

R&R document.write('') # R&R ### Innovation and Entrepreneurship ### MBA 670 Marriott School of Business Brian P. Reschke Fall 2017 ## A perspective on entrepreneurship Entrepreneurship is the relentless pursuit of opportunity without regard to resources currently controlled. —Howard Stevenson ## R&R Case * Application of Porter's Five Forces * Illustration of 'Industry Immersion' approach to entrepreneurship Learning Outcome: Understand customers and competitive contexts ## R&R Case "

Creativity document.write('') # Creativity ### Innovation and Entrepreneurship ### MBA 670 Marriott School of Business Brian P. Reschke Fall 2017 ## Review: R&R Case * Application of Porter's Five Forces * Illustration of *'Industry Immersion'* approach to entrepreneurship * Distinctions: * Customer vs. User * Make vs. Buy (Network) * Product vs. Business Learning Outcome: Understand customers and competitive contexts ## R&R Case "

Status Quo document.write('') # Understanding and Challenging the Status Quo ### Entrepreneurial Innovation ### Bus M 470 Marriott School of Business Brian P. Reschke Fall 2017 ## Course Progress To-Date 1. Introduction to Three Arenas * Desirability, Feasibility, Viability 1. `Industry Immersion` Approach to Entrepreneurship * Bob Reiss and R&R 1. Introduction to `Domain Search` and Creativity * Piero Presentation * Bolster Creative Confidence 1. `Divergence-Convergence`, Team Formation ## Up-and-Coming 1.
